Type.Name: Rc

TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Rc extends System.Object

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

Docs.summary: Object for rc-file handling--- for example, ~/.gtkrc--- and application style and default setting. Rc files can be used to set the colors of just about any widget, and they can also be used to tile pixmaps onto the background of some widgets.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Public constructor; generates a new RC parser.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig void AddDefaultFile(string filename) cil managed

Docs.param: a , the filename to add to the parse list
Docs.summary: Adds a file to the list of files to be parsed at the end of .
Docs.remarks: If is not absolute, it is searched in the current directory.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string[] DefaultFiles { get; set; }

Docs.summary: The current list of RC files that will be parsed at the end of .
Docs.remarks: Unlike the underlying GTK+ function, this function's return string does not use memory owned by the application.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig string FindModuleInPath(string module_file) cil managed

Docs.summary: Searches for a theme engine in the GTK+ search path. This function is not useful for applications and should not be used.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class Gtk.Style GetStyle(class Gtk.Widget widget) cil managed

Docs.summary: Finds all matching RC styles for a given widget, composites them together, and then creates a representing the composite appearance.
Docs.remarks: (GTK+ actually keeps a cache of previously created styles, so a new style may not be created.)

MemberSignature.Value: public static Gtk.Style GetStyleByPaths (Gtk.Settings settings, string widget_path, string class_path, GLib.GType type);
.method public static hidebysig class Gtk.Style GetStyleByPaths(class Gtk.Settings settings, string widget_path, string class_path, valuetype GLib.GType type) cil managed

Docs.param: a , the widget path to use when looking up the style, or if no matching against the widget path should be done
a , the class path to use when looking up the style, or if no matching against the class path should be done.
a , a type that will be used along with parent types of this type when matching against class styles, or G_TYPE_NONE
Docs.summary: Creates up a from styles defined in a RC file by providing the raw components used in matching. This function may be useful when creating pseudo-widgets that should be themed like widgets but don't actually have corresponding GTK# widgets. An example of this would be items inside a GNOME canvas widget.
Docs.returns: a ,a style created by matching with the supplied paths, or if nothing matching was specified and the default style should be used.
Docs.remarks: The returned value is owned by GTK+ as part of an internal cache, so you must call g_object_ref() on the returned value if you want to keep a reference to it. (FIXME: what's the GTK# equivalent of g_object_ref()?)

Docs.summary: The path to the IM module file specified by the RC file. This may be overridden by the GTK_IM_MODULE_FILE environment variable.
Docs.remarks: (FIXME: does this apply for Gtk# too?) In standard Gtk+ applications, the GTK_IM_MODULE_FILE environment variable overrides the im_module_file specified in the RC files, which in turn overrides the default value sysconfdir/gtk-2.0/gtk.immodules (sysconfdir is the sysconfdir specified when GTK+ was configured, usually /usr/local/etc.)

Docs.summary: Obtains the path in which to look for IM modules.
Docs.remarks: (FIXME: "See the documentation of the GTK_PATH environment variable for more details about looking up modules.") This function is useful solely for utilities supplied with GTK+ and should not be used by applications under normal circumstances.

Docs.summary: Returns the name a directory in which GTK# looks for theme engines.
Docs.remarks: Unlike the underlying GTK+ function, the return value of this method is a string, not a directory handle that must be freed later. (FIXME: the GTK+ docs point at the "GTK_PATH" section of "Running GTK applications", which is very detailed and may or may not need included here.)

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig void Parse(string filename) cil managed

Docs.summary: Parses an rc file into the internal data structure.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig void ParseString(string rc_string) cil managed

Docs.summary: Parses resource information directly from a string.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig bool ReparseAll() cil managed

Docs.summary: If the modification time on any previously read file for the default has changed, discard all style information and then reread all previously read RC files.
Docs.returns: a , TRUE if files were re-read.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool ReparseAllForSettings (Gtk.Settings settings, bool force_load);
.method public static hidebysig bool ReparseAllForSettings(class Gtk.Settings settings, bool force_load) cil managed

Docs.param: a , force reload whether or not anything changed if TRUE
Docs.summary: If the modification time on any previously read file for the given has changed, discard all style information and then reread all previously read RC files.
Docs.returns: a , TRUE if the files were re-read.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig void ResetStyles(class Gtk.Settings settings) cil managed

Docs.summary: Recomputes the styles for all widgets that use a particular object.

remarks.para: There is one GtkSettings object per ; see

This method is useful when some global parameter has changed that affects the appearance of all widgets, because when a widget gets a new style, it will both redraw and recompute any cached information about its appearance. As an example, it is used when the default font size set by the operating system changes. Note that this function doesn't affect widgets that have a style set explicitly on them with .

Docs.summary: Returns the standard directory in which themes should be installed. (GTK+ does not actually use this directory itself.)
Docs.remarks: Unlike the underlying GTK+ function, the return value of this method is a string, not a directory handle that must be freed later.
